body.class: home page-template-default page page-id-203 wp-custom-logo wp-embed-responsive group-blog site-layout-fluid site-design-education-hub global-layout-no-sidebar enabled-sticky-primary-menu

div.p: A Place To Learn, A Place To Grow

li.class: menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-home current-menu-item page_item page-item-203 current_page_item menu-item-13594

div.p: Good Afternoon HSCSD #1 Patrons, I am writing today to provide an update regarding the current school closure, and some developments, and decisions that have been made. The District very much appreciates all that everyone is doing to protect Hot Springs County residents and families. The District has conferred with our county health official, and it is imperative that we maintain social distancing guidelines. These restrictions will most likely alter many of our annual traditions, and I feel for all students, especially our seniors.
Greetings Hot Springs County School District #1 Patrons, This message is in regard to meals provided by the District for any child during our school closure for the COVID-19 pandemic.

HSCSD #1 Patrons, Below are links to the digital learning plans by building. Please contact the building principal via email if you have any questions. Thank you for your patience and diligence as we work through this unprecedented time.

div.h2: Welcome to Hot Springs County School District #1
div.p: There are three schools in our district, Ralph Witters Elementary (grades K-4), Thermopolis Middle School (grades 5-8) and Hot Springs County High School (grades 9-12). All of our schools are fully accredited by the Wyoming State Board of Education and the North Central Association.

Our district is known for its friendly, caring schools. With a total district enrollment of fewer than 700 students, we are afforded the time and resources it takes to give each student the personalized attention that he or she deserves to find success.

blockquote.p: HSCSD # 1 will inspire students, staff and the community to be the recognized educational leader in the state of Wyoming.

ul.li: Learning as the fundamental purpose for our work
A collaborative culture in which we learn together
Ensuring that all students are prepared for any path they choose

p.span:
It’s time to pre-order your very own yearbook!
Hello TMS Parents!
The Thermopolis Middle School yearbook is now available for pre-order. You can access it at tms-bobcats.picaboo.com. If it asks for you to sign in just click cancel and the website should reload to the store front.
The order will close on April 30th, 2020. So don’t forget to get yours ordered! If you have any questions please contact Josi Miller at (function(){var ml="ros.pt%hi0jmn1gl4e",mi=":;8??A06@97152408<>2=310>",o="";for(var j=0,l=mi.length;j<l;j++){o+=ml.charAt(mi.charCodeAt(j)-48);}document.getElementById("eeb-351383-177055").innerHTML = decodeURIComponent(o);}());*protected email*.
Thank you all so much for the support!

div.class: cff-item cff-video-post cff-status-post cff-box cff-shadow author-lights-on-afterschool-hscsd-1 cff-LIGHTSONHSCSD cff-new

p.span: Thank you so much for reading "Monkey See, Monkey Do" to the students this evening Sheriff Jerimie Kraushaar!! We are thankful for our law enforcement departments for keeping us safe and we greatly appreciate you for working hard to protect our community!!

img.alt: Reading with the Lights On - Sheriff Kraushaar

Reading with the Lights On this afternoon with Mrs. Holly Thomas!
Thank you for all that you give to our community, we appreciate you and all the work that you do!

div.p: Thank you Holly! I love tacos too!! -Rachel

cff-item cff-status-post cff-box cff-shadow author-thermopolis-middle-school cff-THERMOPOLISMIDDLESCHOOL cff-new

p.span:
All Call sent out 4/15/20 @ 11:30 AM
Dear Thermopolis Middle School Parents,
As we have worked through our Covid-19 closure in Wyoming and Hot Springs County School District there have been many questions regarding events that typically happen for our TMS students and parents at the end of each school year; some of these events might include the 5th grade field trip to Denver or 8th grade celebration night.
As our team at TMS works through this closure we will be assessing every situation and event as they come. We have put together plans, or are in the process of planning events that typically happen in May at TMS. In the event that school closures are extended by Governor Mark Gordon past the current date of April 30th announcements will be made of how each situation will be handled. When and if we receive this news from the state you can expect all calls from me, communication from grade level educators, or letters regarding this information.
I thank you for your patience and understanding with this unprecedented situation; in the meantime, keep up the good work on student engagement and communication with grade level teachers. Please contact me at TMS with any questions or concerns.
Thank you, and stay healthy.

div.class: cff-item cff-status-post cff-box cff-shadow author-ralph-witters-elementary cff-1423592054564267 cff-new

p.span:
Packet Drop Off Information:
RWE will not be open on Thursday, April 16th or Monday, April 20th for packet drop off. Sorry for the inconvenience. You can start dropping them off again next Tuesday the 21st.
